Open Source Project

About SlugPost

Making markdown sharing simple, beautiful, and accessible to everyone.

The Problem We Solve

Sharing markdown files has always been a hassle. Recipients need to download files, use specific editors, and deal with formatting inconsistencies. This creates friction in communication and collaboration.

Our Solution

SlugPost transforms your markdown content into beautiful, shareable web pages instantly. No downloads, no special software, no registration required. Just paste your markdown, choose a URL, and share.

Key Features

Instant Publishing

Your content goes live immediately. No approval process, no waiting.

Custom URLs

Choose memorable slugs for easy sharing and better SEO.

Secure Edit Links

Unique tokens ensure only you can edit your content.

Claim Ownership

Register later to claim and manage all your posts.

Responsive Design

Beautiful reading experience on any device.

Full Markdown Support

Code blocks, tables, images, and all markdown features.

Powered by Laju.dev

SlugPost is built on top of Laju.dev, a modern full-stack TypeScript framework created by Maulana Shalihin. Laju combines the best of modern web technologies into a cohesive, high-performance development experience.

Learn More About Laju.dev

Technology Stack

Backend

  • HyperExpress - High-performance web server
  • Knex.js - SQL query builder
  • BetterSQLite3 - Fast embedded database
  • TypeScript - Type-safe development

Frontend

  • Svelte 5 - Reactive UI framework
  • Inertia.js - Modern monolith architecture
  • TailwindCSS - Utility-first CSS
  • Vite - Lightning-fast build tool

Open Source & Free

SlugPost is completely open source and free to use. We believe in transparency and community-driven development.

View on GitHub Report Issues

Created By

Maulana Shalihin

Built with ❤️ for the markdown community

SlugPost was created to solve a simple problem: making markdown sharing easy and beautiful. What started as a personal tool has grown into a platform used by developers, writers, and teams worldwide.

Built using Laju.dev, a modern full-stack TypeScript framework also created by Maulana Shalihin.
